ygData.subject: Re: Role/Anon/norm
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree with Shooman that this is a good board-- good topics and helpful discussions without all the flaming. I don t mind helping others-- i figured
ygData.messageBody:
I agree with Shooman that this is a good board--
good topics and helpful discussions without all the
flaming. <br><br>I don't mind helping others-- i figured
that would be my role when I signed on as a druid. But
there are so many rude newbies, that assume that they
are entitled to buffs, coin, items-- that it just
gets to me sometimes. If i'm at the bank in Kelethin
trading and talking to friends, and I get spammed with
"Sow me Please?" ten times, I'll often cast harmony on
the newbie, and say "chill out and come see me in 5
mins." <br><br>Just wait till I hit lvl 24 and get
wolfform-- no going /anon then. I took a screenshot one day
on Orc Hill where a druid in wolf from was
surrounded by about 15 newbies, all saying "Can I get SOW??"
So much spam, I had to leave the area due to the
lag!! <br><br>If someone comes up to me and asks for
help, i'll usually help. If someone does a /who all
search, and give me a tell from across a zone asking for
a SOW, I think that ruins the roleplay aspect,
which I love. Sometimes I'll respond with "if you can
find me and ask nicely, I'll consider it," or even
"What are these pestering voices in my head? Mother
Tunare, deliver me from this madness!!" <br><br>I will
not only give buffs, but items to those who see me
and roleplay the request for SOW. "Oh wise student of
Mother Tunare's gifts, might you show me the ways of the
wolf?" When this newbie walked away from me, he not only
learned of the ways of Tunare, but was fast, rock hard,
and floating off the ground. <br><br>I had a Troll
say "Heh, U not so Fast, shory one. U gimme da wolfie
feets and I race you fast!" We made a wager, we raced
(of course I won, but I let him keep his wager), and
I gave him some additional buffs for this fun
request. <br><br>These were people who found me while
/anon-- which I will often go just to get away from the
madness. But they will find you, and ask you anyway-- and
I am happy to oblige most times. It's that tell
from across the zone-- "Can you come to the dock to
give me sow???" that I'm getting away from. <br><br>My
2sp worth (Hey, I'm lvl 20 now, that's
inflation).<br><br>Xela
